solution.text:
we have to find the zeros of the quadratic equation
factorizing the equation we get
\(_{j}_x^2 + _{{j*5}}_x + _{{j*2}}_x + _{{10*j}}_\)
\(_{j}_x(x+5) + _{{2*j}}_(x+5)\)
\(\Rightarrow (_{j}_x+_{{2*j}}_)(x+5)\)
\(\Rightarrow \alpha=\frac {_{{-2*j}}_}{_{j}_}=-2\, and \,\beta=-5\)
Hence the value of \(\alpha + \beta =-2+(-5)=-7\)
\(-7=\frac {-b}a=\frac {_{{-7*j}}_}{_{j}_}\)
Similarly \(\alpha \times \beta =-2\times (-5)=10\)
\(10=\frac ca=\frac {_{{10*j}}_}{_{j}_}\)

content.text:
Find the zeros of the given polynomial \(f(x)=_{j}_x^2+_{{7*j}}_x+_{{10*j}}_\)
select the correct relations between the zeros and the coefficients from the options given below
